body_html:
I got the same error when I failed to use tf.map_fn the right way, the following code may work~

def process(image):
    # u process func
    # eg: return tf.image.decode_jpeg(image, channel=3)

filenames = [image1, image2, image3]

with tf.Session() as sess:
    filenames = tf.constant(filenames)
    processed_images = tf.map_fn(process, filenames, dtype=tf.float32)
    # if necessary:
    # processed_images = tf.concat(processed_images, axis=0)
    images = sess.run(processed_images)

body:
I got the same error when I failed to use tf.map_fn the right way, the following code may work~
```
def process(image):
    # u process func
    # eg: return tf.image.decode_jpeg(image, channel=3)

filenames = [image1, image2, image3]

with tf.Session() as sess:
    filenames = tf.constant(filenames)
    processed_images = tf.map_fn(process, filenames, dtype=tf.float32)
    # if necessary:
    # processed_images = tf.concat(processed_images, axis=0)
    images = sess.run(processed_images)
```
